DataElement.preferredName: Graded Chronic Pain Scale Score Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Graded Chronic Pain Scale Score Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.:The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.:An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Must have a score of "Most Days" or higher on the Graded Chronic Pain Scale Revised (Abbreviated) using the Pain Eligibility Interview.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1901
ReferenceDocuments.description: Must have a score of "Most Days" or higher on the Graded Chronic Pain Scale Revised (Abbreviated) using the Pain Eligibility Interview within the Screening Interview.
